name: Santa Fe Tuna Carpaccio
author: Lyndon
summary: This is a recipe I had made after coming back from Cabo San Lucas.  It's a light and refreshing appetizer that you can't get enough of.
ingredients: 10 ounces ahi (yellowfin) tuna, sushi-grade - sliced 1 inch long and 1/8 inch thick
¼ cup onion, cut into 1/8-inch dice
¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
directions: Slice the French bread 1/4 inch thick, and set aside
Place the tuna slices in a single layer in a flat nonreactive dish
Sprinkle the tuna with onion and capers; drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice
Sprinkle with kosher salt and black pepper
Serve slices of tuna on sliced French bread
